subject: evas/gl_x11: set "EGL_PLATFORM" as "x11" before doing eglInitialize
commitMessage:
evas/gl_x11: set "EGL_PLATFORM" as "x11" before doing eglInitialize

Without 'EGL_PLATFORM" environment variable, eglInitialize() failed
because egl tried to load DRM platform instead of X11 Platform and
also it tried to handle x display value as gbm_device.
"EGL_PLATFORM" has to be set as "x11" for making egl load right module(x11)

Change-Id: Iee8f7382bae6af37386456183a5c028e05091b2b
Signed-off-by: MinJeong Kim <minjjj.kim@samsung.com>

packaging: Bump to 1.12.2

Rebased from tizen's 1.9.3 version

skip: 4b88b54... Add spec file and enable Tizen build
skip: 409a44c... Enable gles building with efl, and disable SHAD_TEXSAM for gl attraibute
skip: 234fe39... Fix ivi building issue
skip: 32569f3... Enable installing examples binaries
skip: ebec758... Enable building multiple binary packages
skip: 87d86f6... wayland: add the xdg-shell protocol files

skip: ebea947... Ecore-Wayland: use modified xdg-shell with "xdg_surface_unset_minimized()"
skip: 50abd47... Decore: wayland: make xdg-shell conditionnal at runtime
skip: 7e25b44... ecore-wayland: fix a phase error in ecore_wl_screen_size_get()
skip: 0d73766... ecore-wayland: Implement ivi-shell support for Ecore_Wayland
skip: 78b3840... Revert "ecore-wayland: Implement ivi-shell support for Ecore_Wayland"
skip: 04092c2... ecore-wayland: update the xdg-shell protocol to 1.6.0

subject: Add ECORE_WL_WINDOW_ACTIVATE/DEACTIVATE event.
commitMessage:
Add ECORE_WL_WINDOW_ACTIVATE/DEACTIVATE event.

Change-Id: Ibc03fb5a771674f15f15d5c5269f8f620d5a0d7a

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Is this submitted upstream 1st ?
if not it should be tracked on jira

Patch Set 1:

Because Semun hope app-core could support pause/resume state in Wayland platform too. But Wayland/Weston hasn't Z order API (like raise/lower in X11). Carsten suggests use XDG shell surface activate/deactivate to achieve this. If necessary, I could submitted a JIRA case. About app-core modification, please refer to https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/25285

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Hi, just brought the subject up with upstream devs. Theorically, this should be forwarded to upstream first, but as we know the XDG-Shell code itself hasn't be upstreamed yet, as the devs are waiting for a stable release...

I guess it does no harm. At worst, when the final code gets upstreamed, the logic and events name will change a bit (and you'll need to adapt). Will ask for a green light though, and ask for merging if we don't get an answer in a reasonable time.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: eina: Eina_Tiler - return a NULL if intersection of two tilers doesn't exist
commitMessage:
eina: Eina_Tiler - return a NULL if intersection of two tilers doesn't exist

Summary:
change eina_tiler_intersection to return a NULL if intersection
of two tilers doesn't exist. and add test case to check it.

This doesn't break ABI/API as this call could already return a NULL value and it
should have been handled by the caller anyway. This just make an expected behavior
more correct.

Test Plan: run eina_suite after building eina test suite

Reviewers: cedric, raster, torori, devilhorns

Subscribers: cedric

Differential Revision: https://phab.enlightenment.org/D1205

Change-Id: Ifabfc12064e303423ab7c6fbace31555f4e7ad28
Signed-off-by: Cedric BAIL <c.bail@partner.samsung.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: eina-tiler: Fix invalid read on eina tiler
commitMessage:
eina-tiler: Fix invalid read on eina tiler

Summary:
Fix invalid read on eina tiler reported by valgrind.
This revision will prevent access to data that was gained from eina iterator, after free of eina_iterator.

Test Plan:
1. Build enlightenment on devs/devilhorns/e_comp_wl branch with efl applyied this patch.
2. Run enlightenment with valgrind options.
3. build enlightenment with this patch
4. Run any wayland app on enlightenment
5. There will be no more invalid read message by valgrind.

Reviewers: cedric, devilhorns, raster, gwanglim, zmike

CC: cedric

Differential Revision: https://phab.enlightenment.org/D1080

Change-Id: I2c4bb00f8a74b880d9e48e71e3d2885fb7dff8ae

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: eina-tiler: fix crash when trying to check intersection between two tilers
commitMessage:
eina-tiler: fix crash when trying to check intersection between two tilers

Summary:
If one of the given tilers is empty, then crash could be occurred in internal while loop of eina_tiler_intersection.
And fix some memory leaks in eina_tiler_intersection and eina_tiler_equal.

Reviewers: devilhorns, raster, cedric, torori

CC: cedric

Differential Revision: https://phab.enlightenment.org/D996

Change-Id: I2e3bf02a03eb027d01d900e457d95d26a9be27d7

subject: ecore-wayland: fix a phase error in ecore_wl_screen_size_get()
commitMessage:
ecore-wayland: fix a phase error in ecore_wl_screen_size_get()

ecore_wl_screen_size_get() returns zero width and height if it
were called right after after ecore_evas_init(). The reason for
this a phase error: the output mode callback, that is the source
for the screen size, is called later.

Originally ecore_wl_screen_size_get() had just one round-trip
synching if the output registration has not happened yet.
Occasionally that might be not enough.

This fix adds a second sync round if needed.  During the first
round the actual interfaces registration callbacks are received.
In response to those registrations additional listeners might be
added, like the output listener for instance. During the second
round the actual output modes are received.

Change-Id: Ie6671c2a82988596a36017b0ca8e96215218de47
Bug-Tizen: TC-1353

subject: wayland: use the xdg-shell protocol to trigger window state
commitMessage:
wayland: use the xdg-shell protocol to trigger window state

Use the optional xdg-shell protocol for maximization,
fullscreen, title settings... in case it is implemented by
the compositor. Fall back gracefully to wl_shell otherwise.

Added feature: minimization.

subject: packaging: disable GLib main loop integration
commitMessage:
packaging: disable GLib main loop integration

g_main_loop() integration is buggy, and causes many packages to send
warnings and have 100% CPU usage. Disable it until we have a
clearer insight on this issue.

Change-Id: I0d83b19b2f74aa5c1f6d555f2b829cc9fe44ffff

subject: emotion: Fix missing include resulting in unknown type GstNavigationCommand
commitMessage:
emotion: Fix missing include resulting in unknown type GstNavigationCommand

At least on the gstreamer1 version in Fedora 19 this include is needed. Glima
reported it as well and I think he also uses Fedora.

modules/emotion/gstreamer1/emotion_gstreamer.c:643:4: error: unknown type name
'GstNavigationCommand'

Even if other distros or gstreamer1 versions do not need this it should be safe
to add it here.

Signed-off-by: Stefan Schmidt <s.schmidt@samsung.com>

Added Author as Signed-Off to push to review.tizen.org

Origin: http://git.enlightenment.org/core/efl.git/commit/?id=a440c8da275600cffa142ca99b611cf9faf7bdad
Bug-Tizen: TIVI-2578/part (Enable to build newest EFL 1.8 on IVI)
Bug-Tizen: PTREL-626/part (efl should support gstreamer 1.0)
Change-Id: Ifa6987b586d54ab07b949130b9e3dbf907067362
Signed-off-by: Philippe Coval <philippe.coval@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: emotion: initial port of emotion to GStreamer 1.0
commitMessage:
emotion: initial port of emotion to GStreamer 1.0

Some commits to port emotion to GStreamer 1.0 and implement some missing features,
clean up code a bit and fix some bugs on the way.

This works as good as the 0.10 code for me now with the emotion examples,
just the Samsung hardware specific code is commented out. This should be
ported by someone who has such hardware, and also in a clean way now that
GStreamer since 1.0 has features to handle all this properly.

There's still a lot of potential to clean things up and fix many bugs, and also
to implement zerocopy rendering. But those are for later if there's actual
interest in this at all.

Commits:

- Update configure checks and ecore example to GStreamer 1.0
- Initial port of emotion to GStreamer 1.0
- Samsung specific code commented out, should be ported by someone
with the hardware.
- Return GST_FLOW_FLUSHING when the sink is unlocked
- Remove unused GSignal from the sink
- Use GstVideoInfo to store the format details inside the sink
- Add support for pixel-aspect-ratio
- Store video format information in GstVideoInfo for the different video streams
- Use GstAudioInfo to store the audio format information
- Remove some unused defines
- Header cleanup
- Implement initial support for GstNavigation interface
- Implement setting of audio/video channel

Reviewers: cedric

CC: cedric

Differential Revision: https://phab.enlightenment.org/D387

Signed-off-by: Cedric BAIL <cedric.bail@samsung.com>

Origin: http://git.enlightenment.org/core/efl.git/commit/?id=9c752106f75c9a6415971cd965eedaf3d15fedc6
Bug-Tizen: TIVI-2578/part (Enable to build newest EFL 1.8 on IVI)
Bug-Tizen: PTREL-626/part (efl should support gstreamer 1.0)
Change-Id: Ibc21f9a2891551402f6dd2d5eb7435691bdf3115
Signed-off-by: Philippe Coval <philippe.coval@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Enable building multiple binary packages
commitMessage:
Enable building multiple binary packages

With this change we now generate one package for each EFL module, just
as it was done in the 1.7.x series when we had different repositories.
This keeps the compatibility of the existing packages and removes the
need of specifying "Provides" and "Obsoletes" tags.

There is one additional package, efl-data, which ships the localization
files and Efl_Config.h. This file contains only information about the
version.

Change-Id: Iab11c00d07663159d18af24035c8fb7ad6be23dd
Signed-off-by: Philippe Coval <philippe.coval@open.eurogiciel.org>
Signed-off-by: Eduardo Lima (Etrunko) <eduardo.lima@intel.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/efl/20131025.082444 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

- The tag means you want to submit commit 425349d9b52fab000fbe1be55af3beaad4200bed in efl branch to OBS, but this commit does NOT exist in efl branch. Please use correct branch name as version in tag name submit/{version}/{date.time}.

Suggest to use "gbs submit" to trigger submission, or use following command to create tag "git tag submit/${version}/$(date --utc +%%Y%%m%%d.%%H%%M%%S) -m "****" ".
